course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: First-Year Writing Seminar: Sustainable Earth, Energy, and Environmental Systems

notes.note: Students are required to attend the Sustainable Earth, Energy, and Environmental Systems speaker series, held every other Monday 7:30-9:00 p.m. Choose another writing seminar if your schedule conflicts with the speaker series sessions.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: First-Year Writing Seminar: Sustainable Earth, Energy, and Environmental Systems

notes.note: Students are required to attend the Sustainable Earth, Energy, and Environmental Systems speaker series, held every other Monday 7:30-9:00 p.m. Choose another writing seminar if your schedule conflicts with the speaker series sessions.

The Fall 2011 offering of this course does not fulfill an ENGRD requirement for students in the College of Engineering. Students who wish to take this course to fulfill an ENGRD requirement should sign up for the Spring 2012 offering instead.
Prerequisite: EAS 1310
Enrollment limited to: Undergraduate standing in Atmospheric Science or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 2200; a calculus course (Math 1110 or 1910); one Chemistry course (high school or college).
Preequisite: Chem 2070, Math 1120, and a course in Biology and/or Geology.
Prerequisite: Two semesters of Calculus and one of Physics.
Prerequisite: 1 year Calculus, 1 semester Physics.
Prerequisite: One year of calculus and one semester of oceanography (e.g., EAS 1540), or permission of instructor.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: Fundamentals of Energy and Mineral Resources

notes.note: Prerequisite: Previous course in geology.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: Statistical Methods in Meteorology and Climatology

notes.note: Prerequisite: 1 intro course each in Statistics (e.g. AEM 2100) and Calculus.
Prerequisite: One year each of calculus and physics.
Prerequisite: EAS 3410 & 3420
Prerequisite: CHEM 2070/2110 or equivalent or permission of instructor. EAS 1101 or 2200.
Prerequisite: CHEM 2070 or 2090 and MATH 1920 or equivalent. Recommended: EAS 3040.
Prerequisite: EAS 3010 or permission of instructor.
